title: Error when using a proxy with rustls for a specific url
body:
I get errors for a request to a specifc https url through a proxy using rustls.
Requests to `https://httpbing.org/headers` are working with rustls.
Requests with openssl are working fine for all urls. 
I'm using a local `tinyproxy -d` instance but it fails with random free http proxies too.

[Full example](https://gist.github.com/nickelc/808a00b92c5f83bc6330ae7746215178) with requests using openssl and rustls for https://httpbin.org/headers and https://api.mod.io/v1/games

#### Simple Example
```rust
use reqwest::{Client, Proxy, Result};

fn main() -> Result<()> {
    env_logger::init();
    let url = "https://api.mod.io/v1/games";
    let proxy = Proxy::all("http://127.0.0.1:8888")?;
    let client = Client::builder()
        .use_default_tls()
        .proxy(proxy).build()?;

    client.get(url).send().map(|_| ())
}
```

#### Error log
```
// Hyper error kind: Parse(Version)

[2019-02-17T20:22:08Z DEBUG rustls::client::hs] Server DNS name is DNSName("api.mod.io")
[2019-02-17T20:22:08Z DEBUG rustls::verify] Unvalidated OCSP response: [...]
[2019-02-17T20:22:09Z DEBUG rustls::client::hs] Session saved
[2019-02-17T20:22:09Z DEBUG hyper::proto::h1::io] flushed 107 bytes
[2019-02-17T20:22:09Z DEBUG hyper::proto::h1::io] read 40 bytes
[2019-02-17T20:22:09Z DEBUG hyper::proto::h1::conn] parse error (invalid HTTP version specified) with 40 bytes
[2019-02-17T20:22:09Z DEBUG hyper::proto::h1::dispatch] read_head error: invalid HTTP version specified
[2019-02-17T20:22:09Z DEBUG rustls::session] Sending warning alert CloseNotify


// Hyper error kind: Close

[2019-02-17T20:58:36Z DEBUG rustls::client::hs] Server DNS name is DNSName("api.mod.io")
[2019-02-17T20:58:36Z DEBUG rustls::verify] Unvalidated OCSP response: [...]
[2019-02-17T20:58:36Z DEBUG rustls::client::hs] Session saved
[2019-02-17T20:58:36Z DEBUG hyper::proto::h1::io] read 40 bytes
[2019-02-17T20:58:36Z DEBUG hyper::proto::h1::conn] received 40 bytes on an idle connection
[2019-02-17T20:58:36Z DEBUG hyper::client] client connection error: an IO error occurred: unexpected bytes before writing message
[2019-02-17T20:58:36Z DEBUG tokio_reactor] dropping I/O source: 1
```
